objects.author: Evan Barnes
objects.title: Memphis vs Houston football game on Friday postponed after Tigers' COVID-19 outbreak
objects.html:
After a COVID-19 outbreak within the Memphis football program, the Tigers and Houston have mutually agreed to postpone their game Friday at Liberty Bowl Memorial Stadium, the AAC announced Saturday.

The AAC will work with both schools to reschedule the game.

The Tigers announced Friday that they had paused football activities due to the outbreak. A source told The Commercial Appeal that at least 20 people within the program tested positive and 20 additional people were quarantined.

"I am disappointed that we will be unable to play the Houston game at this time, but a season without a pause or change was always going to be unlikely," Memphis athletic director Laird Veatch said in a statement. "We will continue to closely monitor all of those impacted and do what is best for the safety and health of our student-athletes, coaches and staff."

The Tigers have already lost two games on their schedule: Purdue (Sept. 12) and UT Martin (Nov. 21). With Houston postponed, the Tigers now have two off weeks in September and another in November besides their regularly scheduled off week in October

The next game on the Tigers' schedule is Sept. 25 at UTSA, and their next home game will be Oct. 17 vs. UCF.

How Memphis football is regrouping for SMU after three weeks off over COVID-19 outbreak Memphis-Houston football game rescheduled for Dec. 5 Sad day for University of Memphis athletics is sadder commentary on state of college sports | Giannotto

The Tigers have already lost two games on their schedule: Purdue (Sept. 12) and UT Martin (Nov. 21). With Houston postponed, the Tigers now have two off weeks in September and another in November besides their regularly scheduled off week in October
